description:
Chrome OS is Google’s operating system, providing simple, secure, speedy, stateless, and shared computing for a scalable ecosystem of devices from desktops to laptops and tablets, enabling users to get high quality a d affordable access to tools, information, and entertainment, and making computing more accessible to all.

As the Technical Program Manager for the ChromeOS Software Team, you will be central to ensuring strategic execution and operational cohesiveness across multiple cross-functional and cross-product teams. You will rely on sound judgment under pressure, a technical background, meticulous attention to detail, and excellent organizational skills to balance a high operational speed with a vision and strategy for transforming the way our users experience the next generation of computers and tablets. Your impact and demonstrated leadership will define the growth of the team.
eeo: At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in a technical field or equivalent practical experience.
  • 5 years of experience managing multi-group, multi-disciplinary projects.
  • Experience with systems hardware (e.g., Intel, ARM, MIPS) and software (Linux, BSD, Android,, Chromium).
  • Expertise in operating systems and mobile and web technologies.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience working directly with external users and business partners, managing consumer or enterprise-facing products.
  • Ability to identify and evaluate technical risk and strategic liabilities and explain the impact of these to technical and non-technical audiences.
  • Ability to translate technically complex issues into simple, easy to understand language.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
responsibilities:
• Provide a voice and vision across teams and product areas (PAs) for new and evolving products that combines technical, product, and strategic business insights.
  • Provide technical and operational consultancy to Engineering and Product to build best-in-class platforms and services and increase operational efficiencies.
  • Serve as a point of contact for other internal teams, ensuring proper prioritization and cross-team alignment, and identifying and solving cross-functional and inter-team issues quickly.
  • Design and develop tools to increase the velocity of engineering work and reliability of product launches. Build and execute standardized processes to address acute or recurring issues such as security vulnerabilities, service outages, and product and feature launches and deprecations.
title: Technical Program Manager, Chrome OS Software
